text: {{Infobox Writer | name = Ernest Gary Gygax | image = Gary Gygax Gen Con 2007.JPG | caption = Gygax at Gen Con Indy 2007 | birth_date = | birth_place = Chicago, Illinois, United States | death_date = | death_place = Lake Geneva, Wisconsin, United States | occupation = writer, game designer | nationality = United States | period = 1971–2008 | genre = role-playing games, fantasy, wargames }} Ernest Gary Gygax (July 27, 1938 – March 4, 2008) (IPA: ) was an American writer and game designer. He was best known for co-creating the early role-playing game Dungeons & Dragons (D&D) with Dave Arneson in 1974.
